instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2330: What is 820-2330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.R7122: What is R7122? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message:
hello friends, i am just working on that  board. MCP still original with edgebonding, seems not touched.

got it yesterday. problem turning on, led is constant on, fan is spinning, no display.

i checked the power rails

seems to be all there

the <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> is 5.11V , is that ok ?

the only one what i missed is <SIGNAL>PPVTT_S0_DDR_LDO</SIGNAL>

<SIGNAL>DDRVTT_EN</SIGNAL> is 0V as well

need some help here.

threads.message: Cpu vcore = 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>IMVP_VR_ON_R</SIGNAL> = 3,43V (<RESISTOR>R7160</RESISTOR> Pin 2)
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_CPU_IMVP</SIGNAL> 12.6V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_CPU_IMVP</SIGNAL> = 5.1V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message: <TRANSISTOR>Q7100</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7101</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7102</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7103</TRANSISTOR>  on Pin4 no impulses to see

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message: CPU Vcore should be there so something is wrong there. Usually <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR>, check voltages to pin 20,22,31.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message: found now in the corner left from the cpu under the cpu coil some korosion. this should be the problem. I will try to solv it and report back.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message:
i replaced now all the resistors and caps ich were looking bad
still i had to solder 2 wires
one from <RESISTOR>R7123</RESISTOR> Pin2 (<SIGNAL>CPU_VCCSENSE_N</SIGNAL>) to <RESISTOR>R1101</RESISTOR> Pin1
second from <RESISTOR>R7122</RESISTOR> Pin 1 (<SIGNAL>IMVP6_VSEN_P</SIGNAL>) to <CAPACITOR>C7131</CAPACITOR> Pin1 

now I have CPU Vcore 1,0V

but still no display
